meanings.definition: Scraighed (verb): past tense of scraigh - to make a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The owl scraighed loudly in the night.
meanings.sent2: Yesterday, the cat scraighed when it got stuck in the tree.
meanings.sent3: The screeching brakes scraighed to a halt at the red light.
meanings.sent4: Her voice scraighed through the silent room, startling everyone.
meanings.sent5: The rusty gate scraighed open, echoing through the empty yard.

meanings.definition: Scraighed (adjective): having a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The scraighed violin made everyone cover their ears.
meanings.sent2: The scraighed alarm woke up the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The scraighed microphone feedback made the audience wince.
meanings.sent4: The scraighed wind howled through the night, keeping everyone awake.
meanings.sent5: The scraighed brakes screeched as the car came to a sudden stop.

meanings.sent1: The scraighed of the train whistle filled the station.
meanings.sent2: The scraighed of the seagulls could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The scraighed of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The scraighed of the rusty hinges echoed in the old house.
meanings.sent5: The scraighed of the violin cut through the silence of the concert hall.
